author: Mike Griffith
title: Traditional power Gonzaga eases into NCAA tourney prep for Georgia: 'This is easy for us'
text:
WICHITA, Kan. ‚Äî Gonzaga players believe they have a built-in advantage over Georgia in the teams‚Äô opening round matchup in the NCAA Men‚Äôs Basketball Tournament on Thursday.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been here before,‚Äù Zags‚Äô redshirt senior Graham Ike said on Wednesday, previewing the teams‚Äô 4:35 p.m. Thursday match up (TV: TBS).
‚ÄúSo we have the experience, we‚Äôre kind of used to these kind of games and environments. I think it does help us.‚Äù
Coach Mike White‚Äôs UGA program is making its first NCAA Men‚Äôs Basketball tournament appearance in 10 years when it tips off against a tradition-rich Gonzaga program that has the longest active streak of Sweet 16 appearances in the nation (nine).
White, who has a string of four-straight NCAA tournament opening round wins carrying over from his time as head coach at Florida (2015-22), said it could take his UGA players a few minutes to get the feel of the so-called ‚ÄúBig Dance‚Äù environment.
‚ÄúUntil you actually play in it, I‚Äôm not sure that your guys will fully feel it, right?‚Äù White said, asked by AJC-DawgNation at his Wednesday press session in INTRUST Bank Arena about UGA‚Äôs lack of NCAA tournament experience.
‚ÄúI think the first media timeout they will have felt it, and we will have to respond to some positives and to some negatives throughout the game, but this group has done that,‚Äù White said. ‚ÄúNow it‚Äôs time to do it on the biggest stage.‚Äù
Georgia won three do-or-die postseason games in the NIT last season, besting basketball schools Xavier and Wake Forest before taking down Big Ten power Ohio State on the road.
But the NIT is different, White knows, in terms of the level of competition and the bright lights shining down on the court.
The Gonzaga players know and understand the value of the school name on their chest, too, and the values for success that have carried over under the sixth-winningest head coach in college basketball, Mark Few.
‚ÄúI think our culture just starts with who we are as a program, the tradition in the Gonzaga program,‚Äù said NCAA assists leader and Zags‚Äô single-season record-holder Ryan Nembhard, who transferred to the Spokane, Wash., school from Creighton before the 2023-24 season.
‚ÄúI think the culture here is second to none, you know, that‚Äôs built through years of different teams, camaraderie, and especially the way Coach Few is just so consistent every year and eery day on what he brings to the table,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSo I think the culture is in us.‚Äù
Georgia is trying to build a successful basketball culture and change the narrative around a program that has little tradition.
The Bulldogs have not won an NCAA tournament game since 2002 ‚Äî later vacated due to NCAA sanctions ‚Äî and have won just one SEC regular season title and two SEC tournament titles in school history.
Georgia lost to Michigan State, another traditional basketball powerhouse, in its most recent NCAA tourney appearance by a 70-63 count on March 20, 2015, in Charlotte, N.C.
Arriving for NCAA tourney pregame festivities in Wichita was, no doubt, different for the Bulldogs from other venues.
The open locker room and elevated stage media press conferences were unique to the NCAA tournament, as was having fans surrounding the basketball court during the Bulldogs‚Äô Wednesday shoot-around session.
Gonzaga shooting guard Nolan Hickman, a first-team All-West Coast Conference selection, shared how casual it feels for himself and his NCAA tourney-tested teammates.
‚ÄúWith us being here already, I think this is something that‚Äôs usual, and it‚Äôs easy for us,‚Äù Hickman said. ‚ÄúWe understand how this thing goes, so I think that‚Äôs pretty much the difference between newcomers and us seniors that have been in it for a while.‚Äù
Ike agreed.
‚ÄúI think for newcomers, like when you get in, I feel something that can be new for them is maybe the highs and lows of March Madness,‚Äù Ike said. ‚ÄúNot getting too high, not getting loo low, but just trying to stay in the middle with it ‚Ä¶. "
Few, one of the most-respected and well-liked coaches in collegiate basketball history, doesn‚Äôt get too carried away with the value of the tradition he has built.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always nice to have experience,‚Äù Few said, ‚Äúbut it‚Äôs going to come down to that 40 minutes of basketball, and who‚Äôs making plays and getting stops, and who isn‚Äôt.‚Äù
Indeed, Nembhard stressed the ultimate difference in who wins the Georgia-Gonzaga game on Thursday could come down to hunger.
‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre not desperate at this time of year, you‚Äôre going on,‚Äù Nembhard said. ‚ÄúWin or go home at this point, and your season is done, so you have to be desperate.
‚ÄúThe least desperate team is probably going to be going home and chilling on the couch.‚Äù

author: JAMnews | English
title: Abkhaz war veteran publicly expressed solidarity with protesters in Tbilisi
text:
Abkhaz veteran supports Georgian protesters
In Abkhazia , Lasha Zukhba, a veteran of the Georgian-Abkhaz war of 1992-93 , who was awarded the highest military honor of the republic, expressed support for the protest actions against the ‚Äú foreign agents bill ‚Äù in the capital of Georgia on his Facebook page. Due to this, the pro-government veteran party of Abkhazia, ‚ÄúAmtsakhara,‚Äù condemned him, while the opposition, on the contrary, criticized ‚ÄúAmtsakhara‚Äù for its ‚Äúselective approach.‚Äù
Generation Z protest: Who's leading the frontline against the 'Russian law' in Georgia. Video In this video, we explain what Generation Z is protesting against and how they self-organize to defend their rights
‚ÄúI express solidarity with the protesters in Tbilisi, the Georgian opposition, and the entire civil society of Georgia in their protest against the adoption of the foreign influence law. We remember your support for our protest against the Pitsunda agreement, and the protest against the foreign agents bill still awaits us ahead.
I hope your efforts will not be in vain and the bill will not be passed. I am confident that people, especially the Georgian people, are unbeatable in their determination. I wish you strength of spirit and success in achieving your goal,‚Äù wrote Lasha Zukhba on Facebook.
This post sparked intense debate in the Abkhaz segment of social media. Mostly, Lasha Zukhba was criticized for his support of the Georgian protest, but there were also those who defended him, emphasizing the veteran‚Äôs military merits.
Exploiting ideological division: Opinion on transfer of Pitsunda estate to Russia Society in Abkhazia against the agent law ‚Äì who said what Kremlin offers Georgia territorial integrity for ‚Äúforeign agents‚Äù law? Opinion from Abkhazia The pro-government veteran party of veterans ‚ÄúAmtsakhara‚Äù called on its colleagues and opposition political forces to give a moral assessment of Lasha Zukhba‚Äôs words, almost accusing him of preparing similar protests in Abkhazia:
‚ÄúHow can a citizen of Abkhazia and a veteran of the Patriotic War in Abkhazia express solidarity with the supporters of Mikhail Saakashvili, who unleashed the war in 2008, supporters of the ideology of extreme nationalism, rejecting the very idea of Abkhaz statehood, independence, and sovereignty, supporters of an ideology hostile to the Abkhaz people?
Secondly, citizen Zukhba, on his own behalf and on behalf of his supporters, thanks Georgian nationalists for supporting protests against the Pitsunda agreement. Opposition forces in Abkhazia criticized the Pitsunda agreement, but what was the nature of this support?
Thirdly, citizen Zukhba announces future protests against the adoption of the foreign agents bill by the Parliament of the Republic of Abkhazia. Does this mean that protests in Tbilisi and future protests in Abkhazia are coordinated from the same center? And finally, a question to citizen Zukhba personally: who are your like-minded people?‚Äù
In turn, another opposition veteran organization, ‚ÄúAruaa,‚Äù stated that it does not support Lasha Zukhba‚Äôs statement, but nevertheless, it is surprised by the accusations from ‚ÄúAmtsakhara,‚Äù considering them a display of double standards.
‚ÄúAruaa‚Äù provides its list of Georgia-related issues to which ‚ÄúAmtsakhara‚Äù did not react:
The covert trip to Georgian territory by Abkhazia‚Äôs Minister of Economy, Christina Ozgan. Lifting the ban on trade relations with Georgia. The visit of Georgian parliament deputies to Abkhazia, and so on. ‚ÄúWe hold the veteran of the Patriotic War of the People of Abkhazia of 1992-1993, Lasha Zukhba, in high esteem for his combat merits and remind ‚ÄòAmtsakhara‚Äô that he was an active supporter of the current government, supporting president Aslan Bzhania during the 2020 presidential elections.
In conclusion, we demand that ‚ÄòAmtsakhara‚Äô provide a moral assessment, first and foremost, of the aforementioned actions of the ruling authorities,‚Äù stated ‚ÄúAruaa.‚Äù

topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance

author: JP Alegre
title: California Declares Emergency Over Bird Flu in Dairy Cattle
text:
California Governor Gavin Newsom has declared a state of emergency over an outbreak of bird flu in dairy cattle, as the virus spreads across US dairy farms and authorities rush to contain its transmission.
The H5N1 virus, detected in dairy cows in Southern California, has now spread to dairy herds across 16 states since first being confirmed in Texas and Kansas in March 2024, state officials said.
‚ÄúThis proclamation is a targeted action to ensure government agencies have the resources and flexibility they need to respond quickly to this outbreak,‚Äù Newsom said in a statement . ‚ÄúWhile the risk to the public remains low, we will continue to take all necessary steps to prevent the spread of this virus.‚Äù
California has the greatest number of human cases overall with 34 of the national 61, according to the CDC.
Read more: https://t.co/oeBCcI1cgh
‚Äî unusual_whales (@unusual_whales) December 19, 2024 The emergency order gives state agencies more flexibility in staffing and contracting to combat the outbreak. California has implemented what officials describe as the nation‚Äôs largest testing and monitoring system for the virus.
Pandemic 2.0 ? https://t.co/skqtLk4y65
‚Äî GrainStats üåæ (@GrainStats) December 18, 2024 No human-to-human transmission has been detected in California, with nearly all human infections linked to direct contact with infected cattle, health officials said.
The state‚Äôs response includes coordination between the California Department of Public Health, Department of Food and Agriculture, and Office of Emergency Services. Officials have distributed millions of pieces of protective equipment to high-risk dairy farm workers and launched multilingual outreach programs.
State authorities are working with federal agencies, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the Food and Drug Administration, and the US Department of Agriculture to monitor potential cases.
The state is also providing dairy workers with additional doses of seasonal flu vaccine to reduce concurrent flu risks, officials said.

author: AFP
title: Blinken says US delivering for Pacific islands despite China's reach - Times of India
text: WASHINGTON: The United States, boosted by allies and the private sector, is delivering for Pacific islands even if Washington alone cannot match China's growing footprint, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said late Friday.Blinken spoke after lawmakers in Solomon Islands, whose warming security relationship with China has sparked alarm in the United States and Australia, choose another Beijing-friendly prime minister. \"China covers a lot of ground in the Pacific Islands, maybe more ground that we can cover ourselves,\" Blinken told the McCain Institute's Sedona Forum in Arizona.But he said that by partnering with like-minded Australia, New Zealand, South Korea, Japan and India, \"we cover a lot of ground.\"\"You're seeing that play out in our ability to help deliver some of the things that people in those countries want,\" Blinken said.\"It is often more effective to say to a country -- we're not asking you to choose, we want to give you a better choice.\"He pointed to an initiative -- announced at a summit last year between President Joe Biden and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese -- in which Google is building trans-Pacific cables to improve internet connectivity in South Pacific countries.The high-speed cables are an alternative to those on offer from China, whose tech companies have been increasingly active in the South Pacific.Tensions have eased between the United States and China, with Blinken last month visiting Beijing for the second time in less than a year, but the Biden administration has declared China to be the top long-term rival to US global leadership.

title: Fuerte tormenta solar tendr√≠a impacto en la tierra: ¬øqu√© efectos tendr√°?
text: A trav√©s de un comunicado, el Centro de Predicci√≥n del Clima Espacial (SWPC, en ingl√©s) de la Oficina Nacional de Administraci√≥n Oce√°nica y Atmosf√©rica (NOAA, en ingl√©s), una divisi√≥n del Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional, alert√≥ de esta particular situaci√≥n, de la que se ofrecer√°n m√°s detalles en las pr√≥ximas horas.Las tormentas geomagn√©ticas, seg√∫n explican, pueden tener impacto en la infraestructura orbital terrestre y en la superficie de la Tierra con el potencial de interferir con las comunicaciones, la red de energ√≠a el√©ctrica, la navegaci√≥n y las operaciones de radio y de sat√©lites. (Puede leer: En fotos: la Nasa mostr√≥ cu√°l es el verdadero color del oc√©ano).La serie de erupciones comenz√≥ el 8 de mayo y las condiciones para que la tormenta persista podr√≠an durar durante todo el fin de semana. "Una gran mancha solar ha producido erupciones desde moderadas a muy fuertes desde el mi√©rcoles", se√±al√≥ la agencia. "Al menos cinco de esas erupciones estuvieron asociadas con eyecciones de masa de la corona solar que parecen dirigidas hacia la Tierra".(Adem√°s: La sonda china Chang'e 6 entra en la √≥rbita lunar: ¬øen qu√© consiste su misi√≥n?).Estas eyecciones son explosiones de plasma y campos magn√©ticos en la corona solar que causan tormentas geomagn√©ticas cuando ocurren en direcci√≥n a la Tierra, explic√≥ NOAA.La gran mancha solar ha lanzado una secuencia asombrosa de cinco eyecciones de masa solar hacia la Tierra, seg√∫n la plataforma Spacewather.com, que estima que, si se tratara de un hurac√°n, ser√≠a de categor√≠a 4.‚Äã‚ÄãEFE
